newsitem.title: USA: IMR Fri share drop may be tied to S&P error.
newsitem.headline: IMR Fri share drop may be tied to S&P error.

text.p: Information Management Group Inc Tuesday said a drop in the price of its shares on Friday February 28 may have been the result of a mistaken earnings estimate carried by Standard & Poor's MarketScope service.
IMR said the online service carried a consensus 1996 fourth quarter estimates for IMR of $0.13 per share. Analysts estimates were actually $0.05 per share.
On February 27, IMR reported fourth quarter earnings of $0.08 per share. The firm's stock dropped to a low of $18-3/8 that day and closed at $18-7/8, off from the previous day's close of $21.
A spokesman for MarketScope said they did not contend the incident and carried a correction regarding the incorrect estimates on Monday, March 4.
Standard & Poor's is a unit of McGraw-Hill Cos Inc.
